org.huahinframework.core
Class Filter

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper<Writable,Writable,Key,Value>
      org.huahinframework.core.Filter

public abstract class Filter
extends Mapper<Writable,Writable,Key,Value>

This class is wrapping the Mapper class. Inherits the Filter class instead of the Mapper class.

Map a simplified process can use the Filter class instead of the Mapper class. Using the filter method, the Record input is passed instead of the KEY and VALUE.

The framework first calls filterSetup(), followed by init() and filter(Record, Writer) for each Record in the input. init() is called before the filter(Record, Writer) is called.

Example:

 public class WordFilter extends Filter {
   public void init() {
   }

   public void filter(Record record, Writer writer)
       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
     String text = record.getValueString("TEXT");
     String[] strings = StringUtil.split(text, StringUtil.TAB, true);
     for (String s : strings) {
       Record emitRecord = new Record();
       emitRecord.addGrouping("WORD", s);
       emitRecord.addValue("NUMBER", 1);
       writer.write(emitRecord);
     }
   }

   public void filterSetup() {
   }
 }

See Also:
Record, Writer, Summarizer
